summary: Project to deploy and operate a backend canister with restart capability and an expectation of continuous uptime (always running).
architectural_notes: Backend canister is expected to be kept running continuously; include an operational approach for restart and uptime (e.g., monitoring/auto-restart).

existing_features.title:
Add an operator script to restart the backend canister on the IC network and ensure the backend canister is started after deploy.

- Create a new script at frontend/scripts/restart_backend_canister.sh that:
  - Checks backend canister status on network ic.
  - If the canister is stopped, starts it.
  - Supports an explicit "restart" mode that performs stop+start.
  - Writes clear, English console output and exits non-zero on failure.
- Update frontend/scripts/redeploy_production.sh to run the backend start/restart logic after `dfx deploy --network ic` completes, so a stopped backend is brought back online automatically as part of the standard redeploy flow.

Update the production deployment runbook to include explicit backend canister status verification and restart instructions.

- Update frontend/DEPLOYMENT_CHECKLIST.md to add a dedicated subsection that:
  - Shows how to check backend status (`dfx canister --network ic status backend`).
  - Shows how to start or restart the backend canister.
  - References the new `frontend/scripts/restart_backend_canister.sh` script as the preferred method.
  - Clarifies that the deployment process should confirm the backend canister is not in a stopped state after deployment.

Improve the frontend startup error experience to guide operators when the backend canister is stopped.

- Update the StartupErrorScreen UI to display an explicit, English troubleshooting hint when the health check indicates the backend canister is stopped.
- The hint must include:
  - The backend canister ID already shown in diagnostics.
  - The exact command(s) or reference to the repo script to start/restart the backend canister.
- Do not require authentication changes; this is informational guidance only.

new_feature_requests.summary: Provide ability to restart the backend canister and ensure it stays continuously running (uptime/auto-restart expectation).

projectName: Add backend canister restart/runbook and frontend guidance for stopped canister
